title.narrative: Support for church-led peacebuilding in South Sudan

description.narrative: The project will be implemented through a partnership between CA and CTP, with CA as lead agency. Implementation of the project will be overseen by a Project Board comprised of CA and CTP senior managers and programme staff who will guide strategy, ensure effective coordination, delivery and quality. CA and CTP will deliver activities to support the SSCC in line with the APP. The SSCC is an ecumenical body comprised of seven member churches and other associate churches with a strong legacy of peacebuilding, reconciliation and advocacy. It provides a local and national platform to enhance ecumenical cooperation through the national networks of its member churches and supported by the national secretariat. Through its national structure, regional offices, and community-level Inter-Church Committees (ICCs), and the hundreds of local churches within its membership, the SSSC reaches millions of South Sudanese. Membership of the ICCs comprise local representatives of SSCC member churches. CA and CTP will work closely with the SSCC and its member churches to support ICCs to implement the APP at the local level through accompaniment, building capacity, and enabling them to interact with and inform the national strategy for the APP through coordination and information sharing. CA and CTP will also work with the national secretariat and regional offices to further strengthen their institutional capacity to implement the APP at all levels. CA and CTP will prioritise effective coordination with implementing Core Group partners through Core Group meetings and Programme Technical Working Group meetings to maximise ability to deliver positive results.
